item.title: Spectacular Anglo-Saxon Sword to go on display at Folkestone Museum
item.description: Finds from a top-secret Anglo-Saxon cemetery in East Kent, including a complete sixth century sword with silver-gilt hilt fittings, will go on display at Folkestone Museum in July 2026. This sword was featured on Digging for Britain last year. It is one of the finest Anglo-Saxon swords ever found in…

item.title: Change the tide with café opportunity
item.description: A new beachside destination at Greatstone is to be known as the Changing Tides Coastal Centre when it opens this year.

item.title: Positive steps forward for Folca
item.description: Significant progress continues to be made behind the scenes on the future of the Folca building in Sandgate Road that includes a new medical centre at its heart.

item.title: Future of swimming pools under spotlight
item.description: Financially supporting the re-opening of Folkestone Sports Centre pool and funding improvements to Hythe Pool are due to be discussed by councillors.

item.title: Recognition for a community of volunteers
item.description: Do you know a community hero who dedicates their own time and skills on behalf of others? Well, we want to hear about them.

item.title: Storm Goretti: Folkestone & Hythe update
item.description: Work is already underway to deal with the effects of Storm Goretti after the district’s coastline faced strong and forceful winds overnight.

item.title: Skill up your business for the new year and beyond
item.description: An exciting skills programme to strengthen the local economy and support small business growth across the district has been launched.

item.title: Studio Sale
item.description: We’re leaving our current space and we can’t take everything with us! Pop along to our studio sale to grab a bargain or two! Open 12-4pm on the following dates (or until we run out of things to sell!):Thu 22 JanFri 23 JanSat 24 JanSun 25 JanWed 28 JanThu 29 JanFri 30 JanSat 31 JanSun 01 …

item.title: Household Support Fund Scheme 2026
item.description: Funded by the Department for Work and Pensions on behalf of the UK government, the Household Support Fund scheme (HSF) supports vulnerable Kent households in need of help with significantly rising living costs. The Government has announced that this current round of HSF funding will be the last. &nb…

item.title: Taking a look at our financial future
item.description: Residents have the opportunity to comment on Folkestone & Hythe District Council’s budget strategy for 2026/27.

item.title: Mindful Messy Making 2026
item.description: Following the success of last years taster sessions we are delighted to be running another series of creative peer support sessions facilitated by Sarah Lloyd. I found I could say things with colour and shapes that I couldn’t say any other way – things I had no words for.” – …

item.title: Christmas is a time for giving
item.description: A bundle of thoughtful gifts will be shared to vulnerable children and young people in the district on Christmas Day thanks to a council initiative.

item.title: The Town Mayor’s Christmas Message 2025
item.description: Firstly, I would love to say Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year to you all. What a year 2025 has been. Whether you’ve had an amazing year or a more challenging one, as it draws to an end let us all take time to unwind and reflect. For me Christmas is about the food, the festivities, s…

item.title: The Town Mayor’s Year 6 Christmas Carol Concert 2025
item.description: Each year the Town Mayor of Folkestone holds a Christmas Carol Concert for all Year Six Primary School children within Folkestone, held at the St Mary & St Eanswythe Church, The Bayle. This year, the Town Mayor, Cllr Lucy McGirr was delighted to welcome almost 300 children from nine schools with…

item.title: A new age for youth forum
item.description: A fresh cohort of students are helping shape the district’s future after joining the council’s youth forum.

item.title: Lower Leas Coastal Park project moving forward
item.description: Some of the existing play equipment at the Lower Leas Coastal Park will be removed ahead of the fun zone’s highly anticipated refurbishment in 2026.

item.title: Folkestone - A Brighter Future updates
item.description: The Folkestone – A Brighter Future scheme is more than a third complete with works planned to finish in Summer 2026.

item.title: Backing volunteers with right support
item.description: Folkestone & Hythe District Council has reaffirmed its commitment to local volunteers and community groups supporting residents.

item.title: The Town Mayor’s Christmas Card Competition 2025
item.description: The Worshipful Town Mayor of Folkestone, Councillor Lucy McGirr, invited students in year groups 7 and 8 at local secondary schools to design a picture reflecting ‘Festive Folkestone’ for this year’s annual Christmas card, which will be sent out to local businesses and dignitaries, including His Maj…

item.title: Councils send proposals for new councils to ministers
item.description: Proposals for the preferred number of new councils needed for Kent and Medway, and the geographical areas they should cover, have been submitted to the government today (Friday 28 November).

item.title: Talking about what matters to you
item.description: Suggestions for topics to be discussed by Folkestone & Hythe District Council’s overview and scrutiny committee in 2026/27 are now being welcomed.

item.title: New edition of Your District Today out now
item.description: A free magazine celebrating the wonderful aspects of Folkestone & Hythe is to make its way through letterboxes from this week.

item.title: Three unitary option backed by Folkestone & Hythe
item.description: Local Government Reorganisation (LGR) in east Kent should be delivered by joining together the council areas covered by Folkestone & Hythe with those of Dover, Thanet, Ashford and Canterbury.

item.title: Launch of Crowdfunder
item.description: The Board of Trustees of the Romney Marsh Community Hub charity, which this year marks its 50th anniversary serving the Marsh, has launched an urgent fundraising appeal to raise £150,000 to safeguard essential services for local residents. The charity has been hit hard by a combination of soaring op…

item.title: Plan for greener district, now for action
item.description: A blueprint for a net zero district by 2041 has been unanimously backed by cabinet members.

item.title: Affordable homes in district taking shape
item.description: Good progress continues to be made on schemes delivering 70 new affordable, green homes in the district.

item.title: Remembrance in Folkestone 2025
item.description: Each year Remembrance events are held around the Country to ensure that we never forget the cost of peace. item.title: Whole load of heavy lifting for district's coastline
item.description: Around 100,000 tonnes of shingle – the equivalent to 1,250 blue whales or 33,000 cars – will be recycled and regraded in the latest phase of beach management work.

item.title: Councils reveal draft business cases for new councils
item.description: Councils from across Kent and Medway have published a series of draft business cases to help inform the next steps in the government’s biggest shake up of local councils in 50 years.

item.title: How to Get Involved in Folkestone’s Future (Even if You’re Busy)
item.description: We all want to live in a town that feels welcoming, inspiring, and cared for. But for many of us, the thought of “getting involved” feels daunting. Who has hours of spare time these days? The good news is that supporting Folkestone’s future doesn’t require huge amounts of time. With Go Folkestone, t…

item.title: Why Local History Still Matters in a Modern Town
item.description: We live in a fast-paced world. Towns change, skylines shift, and new businesses come and go. It can be tempting to think heritage is something we leave in museums or history books. But in reality, local history is what gives a place its character – and without it, we risk losing not only our i…

item.title: Small Acts, Big Change: How Community Projects Shape a Town
item.description: When you picture the kind of projects that change a town, you might think of large-scale developments or huge investments. But often, the most lasting impact comes from the small, consistent actions of people who care. That’s the heart of what Go Folkestone has been doing for more than 20 years &#82…

item.description: We are proud to be one of only three sites in Kent chosen to launch and test the SHUFFLER® — a new portable seated exercise device. item.title: Samuel Plimsoll’s 200th Birthday
item.description: Born today on 10th February 1824… Have you ever worried about being on a sinking ship? Most of us have imagined ourselves aboard a boat the moment it is swallowed by the waves. Before 1876, this was much more of a risk for British sailors than it is now. Without proper safety legislation, so-called …

item.title: The Mystery of the Bronze Age Sword
item.description: Can you help Folkestone Museum solve an archaeological mystery? In 1951 a Bronze Age sword was dredged from the sea, about 36.5 metres (40 yards) from the shoreline off the site of the Roman villa at East Wear Bay. The finder, a local fisherman by the name of Mr H. Brice, was advised that the find m…
